1.Text: A holiday event at...school?
Yes. Do you know about the special holiday?

I do, it's an event that has become popular recently.
It's a day when Santa gives presents dressed in red
and white, and people spend time with loved ones
like family or sweethearts...

That's right, it's an event held only for one special
day, and Princess Alexia, we would appreciate it if
you could join the committee.
(Ugh, I don't want to...)

(Why would I even need to be on the committee for a
holiday party?)

(Really, you just want the second princess of Midgar
to make yourselves seem important. Why me?)

(I want to refuse because it'd be a pain, but that's
the hard part of being royalty. I can't just say
that...)

Okay, I understand. I will give it my full
consideration.

Yes, please think about it positively. We look
forward to your answer!

Whew... I wonder why the big fuss. There has to be
some reason... Oh?

*sigh* Looks like the holiday spirit has already
claimed its first victim...

Oh, Sherry, it's rare to see you here at the Academy
for Dark Knights.
Oh, Alexia! Sorry, I have an appointment to get to.

A meeting... Does it have something to do with the
holidays?

Yes, I've actually joined the committee for the
party...

I heard that our job will be to wear these Santa
costumes to liven things up.
It's cute, isn't it? Heheh.

(Oh, now I see. In order to get me involved,
they anticipated this kind of publicity effect.)

(She's so excited about the costume that she doesn't
see she's drawing a crowd like some kind of walking
advertisement...)

(I feel like the event planners are taking advantage
of her. Well, guess that's my bad habit of looking for
ulterior motives for you.)

It's embarrassing to have everyone stare at me, but
it's for me and Cid...
Cid...?
(Why did Pooch's name suddenly come up?)
Oh! Erm, I just meant as a friend! Nothing more!

(This reaction could be about anything! What is she
planning to do with Pooch while wearing that Santa
costume?)

(Don't tell me she thinks Pooch will join the
committee? Or maybe she's planning to
give him a present wearing that...?)
No, really! Please forget about it!
F-Fine, I won't ask.
(No way I can forget it now! It's totally on my mind!)

(Why does it bother me...? It's none of my business
though.)
Oh, I know! Why don't you join the committee too?
Huh?!

Actually, the committee doesn't have enough members!
Let's make the holiday event a success, together!

O-Okay? Actually, one of the student council members
just asked me to join too...
Wow! Then we can be on the committee together?!

Sherry, slow down. I still have my official duties
to consider.

(The first time I met her, she was so quiet and shy,
but I am getting a very different impression today...)

(There must be something behind it. Maybe she wants
to use the event to get closer to someone?)

You have your duties as a princess, so I shouldn't
be pushy...but...

For me, it would be nice if we could be on the
committee together.

(Urk, if she's going to be this earnest about it,
then it's harder for me to say no.)

...I-I guess. I mean, I do want to be on it with you,
Sherry. I'll give it some thought...

There you are, Sherry! I have a question about the
tree. Can you join me for a moment?
Ah, y-yes! Please excuse me, Princess Alexia.
Don't worry about me. Go ahead.
Thank you! I'll await your return!

(Anyway... I think it's safe to say that Sherry's
participation has something to do with Pooch...)
(Why am I getting so worked up over this...)

(Ugh, I don't like all this thinking! I better gather
some intel to clear my head!)

2.Text:
I can't help but notice the red and white costumes
everyone's wearing these days. What's that all about?

You don't know anything, do ya? Those are the
costumes for the Holiday Party Committee.
Oh, I see... Cid, you listening?
Oh, huh? Yeah, I'm listening.

(I can't help but be fascinated by their normie
exposition.)

(A natural "extra" has something different... This is
why you guys are my side character friends.)

A holiday party... Could be a good chance. It has a
give-a-gift-to-someone-you-like vibe.

This is the perfect atmosphere to get with a girl.
We might have a chance if we find girls who
want to get a boyfriend quick!

If you push a girl into going out with you, you'll
probably break up just as quickly...
That's fine! Better than nothing!

Yes, we are the hyenas of love who pounce on the
most meager scrap of meat!
S-Sure...

(But the holiday spirit really is all over the
place... And it's all Mitsugoshi's fault.)

(It seems like they're using it as a prime business
opportunity, making a ton of holiday cakes. Who
knows if they can sell all of them though?)

(Well, I guess it's my fault for telling Gamma all
that stuff about Christmas and Valentine's Day...)

(Even though this is a completely different world,
these kinds of events are just like those from my
past life.)

Sorry in advance, guys, I'm going to be too busy for
ya on the day of the event.

Heh, yeah, yeah. No way we can get girlfriends that
easily. I'm afraid that it will be just the three of us
spending the evening together, gentlemen.
Um, am I in those plans?
Duh, obviously Cid. You're one of us gu―
Excuse me. Is Cid Kagenou around?
Y-Yes! He is here!
Ack...!

(Seems like you guys remember that time when me and
Alexia were a couple.)

I'm sorry, but I was just talking to one of your
friends, and something came up. You got a
moment?
Uh, yeah... Of course.
D-Don't worry 'bout us. He's all yours!
Go get 'er, dude...!

(Skel, you shouldn't say that while smiling.
You thinking out loud?)

(Besides, this definitely isn't going to be some sweet
convo that they would envy...)
...Phew, no one's around. This will do.
What do you want, Princess?
It's nothing important. Just a couple of questions.

(Ah, the gloves are off. This'll be an interrogation
rather than a sweet chat.)

No. Even if you're a princess, don't think you can
just have your way―
What were you saying, Pooch?

Alexia takes out a gold coin as she says this,
playing with it in her fingers.
Woof!
(Crap, I caught the coin without thinking.)

If I could do whatever I wanted, I wouldn't be here
right now. But you'll answer my questions for a
price, right?
As you wish...

(So if I ask you about your relationship with Sherry
directly, you'll get suspicious.)

(It'll seem like I want to get between you two!
B-But it's nothing like that, so...)

(I need to ask other questions to get info out of
you.)
Have you talked with Sherry recently?

With Sherry? Yeah. Something about the Holiday Party
Committee.
Yes, she was wearing a rather eye-catching costume.
That's the Santa outfit.
I-I know that, obviously!

She asked me a load of questions about presents.
You know, like what I like and stuff.

(Presents... I see now, Sherry is planning to give
Pooch a present.)
Next question. Do you like all this Santa stuff?

Is that kind of question okay? Well, for the right
price, I'll answer anything you want.

I like it. I don't think anyone can really say they
dislike it, right?

(I'm not sure about the gaudy costume, but quietly
sneaking in and leaving presents in the deep of
night when everyone is asleep? Good stuff!)

(That is a true hidden power move. I really want that
kind of skill. I love it.)
S-Sure...

(Somehow I can see that you're saying you really
really love that costume. Yes, you love Santa
costumes!)
Alexia plays with another gold coin on her fingers.
Oh! Please, mistress―

Final question. You interested in being on the
committee?
Nope.

(I would stand out if I dressed like that. It's
against my creed, and it REALLY stands out...)

You're the better choice. You'd look way better than
I would.
Ahh...!

(W-Well listen to Pooch... Does he really want to see
me dressed as Santa so badly?!)

O-Okay... I will keep that in mind. Here is a special
bonus for you.

Alexia scatters gold coins from her pocket on the
ground.
Don't you think you're causing a mess?

Despite the cool tone, Cid eagerly picks up every
single gold coin off the ground.

(I see right through you, Pooch. You're desperate to
see me in a Santa costume. I'll join the committee
and let you see an extra special Santa costume!)

3.Text:
(I wonder what's up with Alexia's aggressive
questioning.)

(Santa... My tongue got all loose on account of the
money.)
Oh my, is that Pooch there?
...Hm? What is this time, Alexi—
...Why are you wearing that?

It's obvious, isn't it? I'm on the Holiday Party
Committee.
*sigh*

You said you like Santa costumes, so here I am,
just for you.

(Did I say something about liking Santa costumes?
I don't really remember, but I'll play along.)

Hmm. Well, it's a bit different from the other
committee members'... A bit fired up, are you?

Oh, so you noticed. That's unexpected. I picked a
costume I liked and had it made to order.

And guess what else? I came all this way to show you.
Don't you have anything more to say?

("Anything more"... It's gaudy, expensive-looking―
basically the opposite of my ideal background
character type. It's definitely something that
screams "I'm a named character.")

(Hmm, I should play along. Like, "It really looks good
on you" or something.)

Yeah, I think it really looks good on you. It's
pretty and amazing. It's perfect on you!
Hmm. Yes, exactly. It's totally me.

Hehehe. I would hang around and let you see more, but
I got bigger fish to fry. Got a committee meeting to get to.
Let's talk later.

What's this? I feel kinda motivated all of a sudden.
What's up with me...

Everyone, thank you for coming to this Holiday
Party Committee meeting.

The student council will manage security on the day
of the event, so we won't worry about that.

So I hope everyone on the committee can focus on
event planning.

So Sherry, could you kindly give an explanation
for the event?

Y-Yes, of course! I am Sherry Barnett, a second-year
student from the Science Academy.

So let me open this meeting of the joint Academy of
Dark Knights and Science Academy Holiday Committee.

(Oh, so Sherry volunteered to facilitate. This is
very different from her typical low-key self.)

Let me cover what we will do specifically. Errrrr...
Where's the chalk...

Sherry writes down the project name on the big
blackboard.

This year, the event is a "Giant Festive Tree."
Putting up a tree will be our big centerpiece.
So let me go into the details.

First, we will decorate the tree with shiny
decorations.
At night it will glitter in the moonlight.

I was thinking we could make it the symbol of the
event space, like a place where people can feel
like they're in the middle of a starlit sky. Also―
Sherry gives a well-covered explanation about the event.

(I think the event has been well thought out, but it
needs one more idea.)
―And that ends my explanation. Are there any questions?
May I speak?
Y-Yes, of course! Princess Alexia, please go ahead.

Recently, it seems like a book titled "The Legend of
the Winter Fir Tree" is popular among the students.

Oh, I know it! That's the latest book by Natsume
Kafka.

In the book, if you tell someone you love them under
a fir tree on a cold winter day, the holy night will
bless you with...eternal love.

If we can relate it to our event, maybe the students
will enjoy the connection?

Oh I see, we intertwine a story that students like
with a setting that turns the school into its stage.
In other words, something the students will enjoy.
I like that story too!

It would be so dreamy to hear "I love you" under a
glittering tree...

Nah, there will be lots of people around. No one'll
have the guts to do it...
Wimp.

We have to set an example―have a success story with
students who are already a couple. How about that?

Certainly, once we have one couple get together,
we'll have an avalanche of confessions.

(It wasn't a totally serious idea, but it seems to
have hit a chord.)

(But it's turning into a romantic event, so there
will be a lot of new couples.)

Wow! Everyone is really getting into your
suggestion!
Thank you, Princess Alexia! I'll work hard too!

I-I am on the committee too, so I just wanted to
contribute...

(...Huh? You want to work harder? I'm not sure you
are talking about the committee―)
Cid! Sorry to keep you waiting!
What's up? Why did you want to meet here?
Um, here! It's a present from Santa!
Wow...! Are you sure?
Yes, please take it!
That's sweet of you. Thank you.

Um, actually, I didn't want to just give you the
present.
Huh?

Do you happen to know "The Legend of
the Winter Fir Tree"?

You know, if you tell someone you love them under a
fir tree on a cold winter day, the holy night will bless
you with eternal love.
Is that so... Huh? Wait, is this―
Cid... I...like you.
Sherry!
The most important present is me. I am your present!
No, that'll never happen.
Umm? Is there something wrong with our plan?

Urk...no, nothing. Sorry. I was thinking about
something else.

Is that so? Please feel free to speak up if you think
of anything.

(Whoops, I accidently said that out loud. What's up
with me, randomly imagining things and speaking
out loud...)

(The pretend couple thing between me and Pooch is
over. It's none of my concern if something happens
between Pooch and Sherry.)
(I'm feeling kind of...restless about this.)

4.Text:
Okay, everyone, let's have a look at the layout of
the area.

(I've noticed since the last meeting, but I'm
definitely sensing a different Sherry.)
(Something's got her riled up... Maybe it's Pooch?)

We'll be joining you today. Let us all do our very
best!
Hello, everyone.

So Rose, we're thinking of having the big tree
in the middle of this area.

I see, though the first thing that comes to mind is
that a tree there will get in the way of practical
courses and club activities.

I contacted you beforehand, but I'll have the
student council send out a notice again.
Do you have anything to add, Alexia?
Alexia?
...Oh! Sorry, what was that?
(Oh crap, I spaced out.)

Perhaps you're fatigued from your royal duties?
If so, I can take over...

No, that is not what I... At any rate, thank you for
your concern.

Please try not to overdo it. Now, let us begin with
the transportation of the tree and gifts...

We are going to get a fir tree. I want a big one...so
we're getting one from the Northern Kingdom.
I see, that's wonderful. As for the route...

(Look at them poring over the map like that...
They're really getting into this. I'd better get my
act together too...)

If my memory serves me right, that area between the
Northern Kingdom and Midgar Kingdom is a famous
wholesale district.

If we order decorations and presents together with
the tree, I think we can get a large order discount
on transport.
You may be right.

(Rose is a member of a royal family, so she must be
learning about commerce and trade.)

That would mean...if we don't use up the budget,
then we can buy extra presents.

Shall I go to the wholesale district to make the
order? I was planning to go by there anyway.

Good thinking. If we make our order now, then it'll
be easier to find a transport merchant...

U-Um...! That's...! Could you give me some time to do
it myself?
Sherry?

Erm, well, Rose is already busy as student president,
so I'd feel bad if we make you do the ordering too.

No need for concern. Really, I do need to go there
about another matter anyway.

You see, I...I kinda want to go there...
to choose a gift...!
Sherry...

(This is rare. Sherry doesn't usually assert herself
like this.)

(...Maybe not just that. Is she planning to buy a
present for Pooch at the wholesale district?)
(In that case, I have to...)

I understand, Sherry. Not that there is a particular
hurry, but please choose a gift quickly.
Yes! I'm sorry. I'll choose one right away.
...Please excuse me.
That was odd of Sherry. I wonder what that was about.
I think it's probably something personal.
Personal?

I think she wants to personally choose a present for
someone.

Oh, okay... Then, maybe I was meddling too much with
my suggestion.
No, it wasn't... Sherry was just being selfish.

It's good though, isn't it? She's usually so docile.
I'm glad if she can be a bit more selfish.

I thought she had been acting differently lately,
but if there are underlying circumstances then
it's understandable.

How about you go to the wholesale district together
with her?
Wh-Who, me?

I would like you to be by her side and support her.
You know, stop her from going around in circles.

I have security duties as part of the student council,
so it would be strange for me to go with her after
the chat we just had.

Alexia, please look after Sherry. I will do my part
to protect the academy while you are gone.

I will protect the students no matter what. After
that last incident...who knows what might happen?

...Very well. Please leave Sherry and the
supplies to me.

5.Text:
Wow...the wholesale district...! There are so many
merchants!

The motto here is, "We treat you like family." There
are merchants discussing business all over the place.

From over there, I can smell something really
sweet... The smell of cakes.

Sherry, you are gawking a lot, like a country
bumpkin.
Ohh... Sorry. I will conduct myself properly.

Yes. Now let's go to a toy wholesaler to order
presents.

That went without a hitch. Takes just one mention of
Alexia's name...

That shop assistant was happy to be a purveyor to the
royal family.
Well, I am a Princess of Midgar Kingdom.

I don't particularly go around dropping names about
who sells me things, but their goods weren't half bad.

(But I didn't like that shop assistant. Their eyes
lit up as soon as they heard my name.)
Next we should order cakes. Is that okay, Sherry?
Ah, yes!

I made a list of cake shops which have my personal
mark of approval!

(I thought you were going to buy something for Pooch,
but maybe you're thinking of a cake rather than
something else.)
...We need a lot, like this many. Can you do it?

Yes, we can. The weather is cold here, so we can make
ice cream cakes.

They keep for a long time, so we have plenty of
stock. Delivery tonight, yes? We will manage it
somehow.
Wow, that's great!

Here is the money and a list of merchants who will
come collect the cakes.

...Okay, I understand. Thank you for ordering with
us.

Um, I heard that customers can experience cake making
 here...?

(Finally...! Now I get it. She intends to make a
Christmas cake here for Pooch.)
Oh yes, we have that kind of service for tourists.
Rose's words float into Alexia's mind.

I would like you to be by her side and support her.
You know, stop her from going around in circles.

(Sherry, I'm sorry. I really do want to support you,
but...)
Sherry, I don't think we have time for this.

The shop will likely need to make arrangements to
cart everything off tonight.

They're prepared for that, but it's unlikely they
can do much for us during such a busy time.
Y-You're right...
Sherry seems taken aback.
I am truly sorry. It is just as you say.

No, that won't be an issue. At any rate, thank you
for handling the delivery.

Yes, please leave the cakes to us. Thank you for your
order!

(Ah, I feel terrible... Sherry is doing her best,
but I ruined her plans.)

Although the shop assistant is smiling cheerfully,
Alexia feels storm clouds in her heart.

Oh...it's already time to meet the merchant who is
transporting our fir tree.
Um, Alexia! Thank you for earlier!
Why are you thanking me?

Because...you were right, Alexia. Something was up
with me.

I was just thinking of myself. I wasn't thinking
about others' time or availability...

Alexia, you set me right. You're a true leader above
all others. You're amazing!

(You're not being unpleasant or sarcastic. You're
really being sincere.)
...I want to thank you too. I feel better now.
Huh, why are you thanking me, Alexia?
Why? I just thought I should.
Hehe, you can be strange sometimes, Alexia...
Yeah, I'm strange... Haha.

(My chest still feels tight, but I think that the
storm clouds are dispersing.)

By the way, the merchant is late. He should have met
us here before the sun set.

That's true, if he was going to be late he should
have let us know in advance...

A long shadow falls on the meeting place, rocking
side to side on unsteady footsteps.
E-Excuse me... My goods... Monsters...

6.Text: E-Excuse me... My goods... Monsters...

(I thought we just had to contact the merchants
transporting the tree...but it seems I was wrong.)
Are you okay?! Let me treat you!
Urgh... Thank you...so much...

You mentioned something about monsters, but can you
explain in more detail?
It was...an accident... The tree fell...suddenly...
The monster cage...I was carrying... It broke...
Huh...?! Why do you have monsters...

Probably just for show. Some noble families and royal
family members have that kind of bad taste...

(In any case, there will be monsters on the loose
near where the accident happened.)

We need to take down those monsters. Otherwise we
can't get our tree.
But that means...the event would be cancelled...!

The committee, Rose, and the merchants all worked so
hard. Cid and the other students are counting on us,
too!
Pooch...

(No, it isn't just Pooch... At this rate, Sherry's
hard work and drive will all be for naught, too!)
Alexia! I-I...!

Yes, let's beat the monsters and get those goods
back!
Where did the accident occur? We'll head to the scene!

M-My apologies... The beasts were in a forest near
town—
*huff, huff*

By the time they reach the scene of the fallen tree,
the sun is almost set.
Wow, so many...

Yeah, so many decorations. They really, really
stand out...

At the site of the accident, there are wagons that
have been destroyed or overturned by the fallen
tree, and ornaments are scattered all around.
Rrrrrr.... Grrrr!

Seems like a monster was also injured in the
accident. Looks like it's keeping still and trying
to recover.

They say a wounded beast is more dangerous. We need
to keep our guard up...

(Sherry is shaking. It's natural to be scared when
facing a horde of monsters.)
Sherry, do you have any battle experience?

Almost nothing at all... But if it's got anything to
do with artifacts, that's different...!

Then can I ask you for combat support? I'll stay up
front.
I've got your back!

(I don't actually have much combat experience, but I
can fight better than she can.)

(I don't match up to my sister Iris...but I still
have my sword!)
Are you ready, Sherry? Let's do it!
In front! Two o'clock!
Take this!
Gwoaaarrr!!!
Three coming at 10 o'clock!
I see them!
Gwoaaarrr!!!

(There's a lot of them, but they aren't that strong!
I could almost handle this on my—)
Agh! My eyes...!

(Damn, blood splashed right in my eyes! This is not
good...!)
Alexia!
Grrr, rar...!

Once her vision clears, Alexia sees that a third
monster has been felled with a stone.
Yay, I got it!
Wow, Sherry! Nicely aimed!

Just keep throwing like that! Even if you miss a weak
spot, it will divert and confuse them!
Y-Yes!

(I could recover thanks to Sherry! The two of us can
do this!)
Rrrr, grah!!

These monsters were caught and desperately want to
live, but so do we!

Really? I thought you might be a type of softy who
feels sorry for monsters.
Maybe before, but―!

(A small bird that was raised in a cage is about to
be released to fly free...)

(Looking at Sherry now, I am sure she feels that
way.)
Look! In the back!

Th-That certainly is a big one... Oh? Could that tree
down there be the one we ordered?!
Brrrr!! Pwweee!!
Is that their boss?
How to say this... It'scuter than I expected...

Don't be fooled by its appearance! These types of
monsters move in packs, like bees following their
queen!
Too long! Short version, please!
Defeating the boss will end the fight!
Got it! Let's go!

Alexia and Sherry leap toward the boss. To save their
tree, and to save the event.

7.Text: Fweee...
*huff, huff*
We did it...right?
Yes, we finished it...
Are you two alright?!
Rose...! You actually came!
A line of wagons can be seen following after Rose.

You arranged for other merchants to carry the
tree and gifts.
I have different priorities than you two do.
Huh?

You two are more important than these things.
Please remember that.
O-Oh, I'm sorry.
My apologies, but thank you.
Yes. Well, I'm glad to see everyone is unharmed.

Now, let's get everything moved onto the wagons,
shall we? We can have a proper chat on the way back.
Yes, let's do that.
It's freezing...

Yes...but the air is clear, and the stars look so
beautiful.

I heard we'll have clear weather on the night of the
event. It will be nice if we could have this kind of
starry sky.

Yes... I hope our goods are delivered to the academy
by then.

The merchant wagons are going slow, pulling that
large tree and carrying all the presents.

If it was by a fast carriage, then it would have
arrived already...

Alexia, I understand your impatience, but let's keep
our spirits up.

If they hurry too much and get into another accident,
they might not make it in time.
You have a point...

At this pace, we should make it in time. Nothing to
do but pray we get there safely.

This is like a reversal of that cake thing.
This time, you set me right.
Hehe, I guess I did.

The merchant wagons took a whole day and night to
arrive―
Three, two, one! Heave!
The tree is ready!
Everything is completed just in time for the event.

It is really thanks to everyone who helped dig the
hole for the tree, even though they aren't on the
committee... Thanks, everyone.

Well, the student president asked us. But once we got
into it, we really dug in.

(From what I heard, Pooch and his friends took the
initiative themselves to dig the hole. I guess they're
trying to improve their grades.)

It's a day early, but this...this is for helping us
out. Please take it!

Wow, an assortment of cookies and candies.
You really didn't have to.

...Cid, you really are my friend, so I wanted to
give you something special...

Oh, really? I prefer getting nothing, or to get the
same thing as everyone else. Don't want to stand
out too much.

Huh? Really? Well, I guess it worked out in the end
so I'm glad!

That's great, you got a present. By the way, you're
not getting anything from me, I chipped in with
Sherry.
Hey, you forgot to look innocent.
Grr...! Oh, shut up!
Anyway, here is a present for the two of you.
Huh?
I mean it. Please take it for the end of the year.
End of year gift?

Wha...? This is an expensive cake from Mitsugoshi!
It costs triple what we paid for your present!
Ulp, so expensive... Is it really okay?
For me too? Not just Sherry?

You too, of course. Good work on the committee.
You had it rough.
Aaah!

(What is this! Damn you, Pooch! You and your squishy
simple face, doing something clever...!)

Despite herself, Alexia turns away from Cid to hide
her reddening face. Something cold suddenly hits
the tip of her nose.
It's snowing! Hehe, let it snow...!
Let it snow? That has a nice ring to it!

Indeed. And I have to say, this makes for quite the
pretty picture...

And so Alexia's and Sherry's tough holiday season
comes to an end.
Alexia is unable to look Cid in the face all day.

And Sherry smiles, holding the present from Cid
tight to her chest...

Gamma, I gave that cake you couldn't sell to some
friends.
